meanings.definition: To discourage or advise against something.
meanings.sent1: She dehorted her friend from taking unnecessary risks.
meanings.sent2: The teacher dehorted the students from cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: He dehorted his cat from climbing the curtains, but it didn't listen.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds dehorted us from going on a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The warning signs dehorted hikers from entering the dangerous area.

meanings.definition: To urge or encourage someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach dehorted the team to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent2: She dehorted her brother to pursue his passion for painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician dehorted the audience to participate in his magic tricks.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker dehorted the crowd to believe in themselves.
meanings.sent5: The mentor dehorted the mentee to never give up on their dreams.
